summary:
The Pallas's cat is a small wild cat found in Central Asia. It has grey fur, low-set rounded ears, and a long tail. Its body length is about 18-26 inches. This cat is adapted to cold, dry climates and lives in rocky grasslands. It eats mainly rodents and lagomorphs. Pallas's cats are good at hiding in rock crevices and burrows. They have 2-6 kittens in the spring.

Although they are widespread, some populations are at risk due to poaching and habitat loss. Many zoos worldwide have Pallas's cats in breeding programs to help protect the species.
title: Pallas's cat
